[[File:Galaxy Nexus smartphone.jpg|thumb|180px|Phones like the [[Galaxy Nexus]], part of the [[Google Nexus]] series, are designed to allow root access<ref>http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2010/12/its-not-rooting-its-openness.html</ref>]]
'''Rooting''' is a process that allows users of [[Mobile phone|mobile phones]] and other devices running the [[Android (operating system)|Android operating system]] to attain privileged control (known as "[[Superuser|root access]]") within Android's Linux subsystem with the goal of overcoming limitations that [[Wireless carrier|carriers]] and manufacturers put on some devices. It is analogous to [[iOS jailbreaking|jailbreaking]] on devices running the Apple [[iOS (Apple)|iOS operating system]].
'''Rooting''' is a process that allows users of [[Mobile phone|mobile phones]] and other devices running the [[Android (operating system)|Android operating system]] to attain privileged control (known as "[[Superuser|root access]]") within Android's Linux subsystem with the goal of overcoming limitations that [[Wireless carrier|carriers]] and manufacturers put on some devices. It is analogous to [[iOS jailbreaking|jailbreaking]] on devices running the Apple [[iOS (Apple)|iOS operating system]].
